item.title: Why is there a need to anthropomorphize language technologies?
item.description: Some weeks ago, we heard about Blake Lemoine, a Google engineer who claimed that LaMDA, a chatbot that can carry unstructured conversations with people, had a ‘human soul’ ðŸ¤¯. He came to this conclusion after having long, deep conversations with LaMDA, which he later shared with The Washington Post. What’s striking about this case is that an engineer, who’s supposed to have a thorough technical knowledge about how chatbots work, was fooled into believing the chatbot was actually human!
